unalcol.types.integer

Class IntUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • unalcol.types.integer.IntUtil

  • public class IntUtil
extends java.lang.Object

    Set of constants and methods operating on the primitive int data type, for example, for accessing the bit representation of an int

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2009

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jonatan Gomez Perdomo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DIV_MASK
      Integer used to apply the division operation respect to the integer size
      static int HIGHEST_BIT
      A integer with the highest bit set in one and the remaining bits set in zero
      static int INTEGER_SIZE
      The number of bits used to represent an integer
      static int LOWEST_BIT
      A integer with the lowest bit set in one and the remaining bits set in zero
      static int MAX_INT
      The maximum integer that can be represented
      static int MIN_INT
      The minimum integer that can be represented
      static int MOD_MASK
      Integer used to apply the modulus operation respect to the integer size
      static int ONE_BITS
      A integer with all the bits set in one

        The number of bits used to represent an integer

      • MOD_MASK

        public static int MOD_MASK
        Integer used to apply the modulus operation respect to the integer size

        x & MOD_MASK = x mod INTEGER_SIZE

      • DIV_MASK

        public static int DIV_MASK
        Integer used to apply the division operation respect to the integer size

        x >>> DIV_MASK = x div INTEGER_SIZE

      • ONE_BITS

        public static int ONE_BITS
        A integer with all the bits set in one

        public IntUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • binaryToGray

        public static int binaryToGray(int num)
        Transforms an unsigned binary number to reflected binary Gray code. For example the integer value 2 is represented in binary code as: 0000.....0010 2 is represented in gray code as: 0000.....0011 (3 in binary) binarytoGray( 2 ) = 3
        Parameters:
        num - Integer number to be converted to Gray code
        Returns:
        Integer value that represents the value num (in gray binary format)

      • getBitsNumber

        public static int getBitsNumber(int n)
        Determines the minimum number of bits required for representing n different values
        Parameters:
        n - Number of different values
        Returns:
        Number of bits required for representing such n different values

      • grayToBinary

        public static int grayToBinary(int num)
        Transforms a reflected binary Gray code number to a unsigned binary number. For example, 0000.....0011 in binary code represents 3, but in Gray code represents 2. grayToBinary( 3 ) = 2
        Parameters:
        num - Integer number in Gray code that will be converted to Binary code
        Returns:
        Unsigned Integer value that is represented by the Gray value num
